title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Patent and Trademark Office)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (U.S. Patent and Trademark Office)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Patent and Trademark Office,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Providence Police Department)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Prostitution and Related Charging Documents (Providence Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All charging documents filed by your department in all cases of:

11-34.1-2. Prostitution
11-34.1-3. Procurement of sexual conduct for a fee.
11-34-11. Loitering for indecent purposes in or near schools
11-34.1-6 Soliciting from a vehicle
23-20.8-3 Practicing massage without a license

filed by your department between July of 2021 and the date this request is fulfilled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bella Robinson

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All meeting minutes, monthly progress reports, draft reports, slide decks, and other work products related to the work performed under Contracts #151553 and 151533-1 regarding RNG potential in New York State. 

Please limit the search window to 2/19/2020 to the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone:

I write to acknowledge receipt of the FOIL request that you submitted to the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA").  Your request seeks the information outlined below.

Your request has been referred to the appropriate NYSERDA program areas to search for the records that are responsive to your request.  NYSERDA will contact you in twenty (20) business days to (i) advise whether it has any records that are responsive to your request; (ii) grant or deny your request, if it has responsive records; or (iii) apprise you of the progress of your request, if the search or review of the records that you requested is still on-going.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Madeleine Stone-

The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority ("NYSERDA") requires additional time to process your request and review the responsive records to determine whether the records fall under an exemption contained in the NY Public Officers Law section 87(2).  I note that this request and your February 2, 2024 request (see below) appear to be seeking the same records.  Please advise whether either the February 2 or March 18 can be withdrawn as duplicative.  NYSERDA anticipates completing your request, unless you advise us to withdraw it, by June 28, 2024 and will let you know if additional time is needed.  Thank you.

February 2, 2024 request
All email correspondences (including email attachments), meeting minutes, and presentation documents from meetings between NYSDERA officials and ICF energy consultant Maurice Oldham that contain one or more of the following search terms:
> Renewable Natural Gas
> RNG
Please limit the search window to email correspondences and meetings that occurred between January 1, 2020 and April 1, 2022.

Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel and Records Access Officer

NYSERDA
17 Columbia Circle | Albany, NY 12203-6399

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RNG in NYS study materials
communications.communication:
Dear Madeleine Stone:

The New York State Energy Research and Development Authority continues to review the emails and attachments responsive to your Freedom of Information Law request.  This review includes determining whether any information should be withheld from disclosure under the exemptions set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 87(2).  I note that any emails or attachments which include proprietary, confidential, or business sensitive information are required to undergo an additional review by ICF as set forth in NY Public Officers Law section 89(5).  This additional review entails NYSERDA seeking a confidentiality justification letter from ICF, ICF reviewing each responsive email and attachment sent to it and drafting a letter to NYSERDA with its confidentiality assertions.

Given this, NYSERDA anticipates completing its review of the responsive records no later than September 20.

Thank you for your continued patience.


Colleen Dawson
Senior Counsel

NYSERDA
17 Columbia Circle | Albany, NY 12203-6399
P: 518-862-1090 ext. 3454 | C: 518-928-7510 | Email: Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov<mailto:Colleen.Dawson@nyserda.ny.gov>

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All written requests for UAS deployment from January 1, 2023, through December 31, 2023.

- The flight logs from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023, for all unmanned aerial drones and vehicles used by the department.

Please see this link as an example of the format of records that I am requesting. https://www.muckrock.com/foi/carson-city-county-8863/carson-city-sheriff-drone-program-140470/#comms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ariel Van Cleve

communications.subject: Town of Gilbert - Records Request Confirmation- GPDR2024-19852
communications.communication:
* 
  
   
  
 Thank you for submitting a records request to the Town of Gilbert. 
  
 We strive to complete routine requests as promptly as possible, but keep in mind that the Town of Gilbert is closed on Fridays and most government holidays. 
  
 Various factors also affect processing time, including the size and complexity of the request, nature of the records sought, and parameters provided.  The records provided to you will be based off the specific search parameters and keywords defined in your records request.   
  
 You can check the check the status of your request or access your documents by clicking on the reference number link below.  Remember to check your spam filter or junk mail folder for any email correspondence from the Town.  
  
 Reference number is Request Number: GPDR2024-19852. 
  
 Security key is EA2B7759.  
  
   
  
 For questions regarding requests, please email to the below: 
  
  
 Public, Build (Eplan) and GIS = ClerksOffice@gilbertaz.gov.  
  
  
 Police Records = gilbertpdrecords@gilbertaz.gov. 
  
  
 EMS Records (Patient Care Reports and Billing) and Fire Reports (Incident and/or Inspection) = GFRD.records@gilbertaz.gov  
  
  
 You must provide your security key and reference number when inquiring about your records request.   
  
   
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Town Of Gilbert 
 50 East Civic Center Drive | Gilbert, AZ 85296 
 Mon-Thurs, 7:00am - 6:00pm; Closed Fridays

Rose Terse 
164840-66651629@requests.muckrock.com

If you have any questions, you may send messages using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481.

Rose Terse

RE: Public Disclosure Request#: P185314-061024 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
This communication is in response to your public disclosure request received on June 10, 2024. 
Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this is notification that the Office of Police Accountability has received your public disclosure records request and needs additional time to respond. 
We will provide the records to you on 9/16/2024. 
We are initiating the process of researching your request, collecting responsive records, and/or preparing records for dissemination. 
 
If you have any questions, you may send a message using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481. 
 
Sincerely, 
Dianalynn Oreiro 
Seattle Police Department 
Legal Unit

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P185314-061024
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P185314-061024. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P185314-061024. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-P185314-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Dear Rose Terse, 
Your records have been released and are available on the Public Records Request Center to download. 
We are providing an Excel spreadsheet containing a listing of OPA allegations in IAPRO since June 1, 2023. This concludes OPA's response to your request and your request is now closed. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: P185314-061024. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
OPA will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so within 10 business days. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Please include your name and address, a copy of any redacted files, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CMS Investigative File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The complete investigative case file related to the deficiencies documented at Holston Valley Medical Center, Kingsport, Tennessee, on March 10, 2020, the survey completion date for EventID: O07B11. The investigation stems from complaint #50499 following the death of an unnamed patient who was admitted Nov. 9, 2019 after a motor vehicle crash and later died at the hospital (Facility ID: TNP531133) on Nov. 11, 2019. Please use the attached CMS-2567 form to aid in the production of the complete investigative file. 

This file may include but is not limited to: emails, written notes, video and audio recordings, copies of documents reviewed, transcripts of interviews and 911 calls, and settlements.  

I’m requesting expedited processing due to a “compelling need” for the public, particularly the residents of northeast Tennessee, to know about this hospital’s quality.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: FOIA-102620237074
communications.communication:
Good evening,
 This office is presently conducting a review of our pending Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests to ascertain if the requested information for the above referenced FOIA case is still desired. We apologize for the delay in responding to your request. However, because of the increasing number of requests received by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS), we found it necessary to adopt the ruling in the case of Open America v. Watergate Special Prosecution Force, 547 F.2d 605 (D.C. Cir. 1976) and exercise due diligence by following a first-in, first-out FOIA processing.
 If you are still interested in receiving the documents, please respond to this email, and we will complete the processing of your request. If we have not received your response within 30 working days from the date of this email, we will assume you are no longer interested in receiving the documents and the case will be administratively closed. Thank you in advance for your time and consideration on this matter.


Jason Mastropaolo
Jason Mastropaolo
Technical Advisor
Division of FOIA Analysis -A
Freedom of Information Group
Office of Strategic Operations and Regulatory Affairs
Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services
E-mail:  jason.mastropaolo1@cms.hhs.gov<mailto:jason.mastropaolo1@cms.hhs.gov>

Please use the attached CMS-2567 form to aid in the production of the complete investigative file.

This file may include but is not limited to: emails, written notes, video and audio recordings, copies of documents reviewed, transcripts of interviews and 911 calls, and settlements.

I’m requesting expedited processing due to a “compelling need” for the public, particularly the residents of northeast Tennessee, to know about this hospital’s quality.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fhealth-and-human-services-centers-for-medicare-medicaid-services-239%252Fcms-investigative-file-153441%252F%253Femail%253DJason.Mastropaolo1%252540cms.hhs.gov&url_auth_token=AAAjzg093T6iyQ54m6mi88Izh4A%3A1sqIxC%3AhJtge0R4NYtj9n0BAQ02pjDL2-56aXlC721O3xjoJNY

If prompted for a passcode, please enter:
FXLPBGBK

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 153441-30207306@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:153441-30207306@requests.muckrock.com>

PLEASE NOTE OUR NEW ADDRESS
For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 153441
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #102620237074
communications.communication:
Hello, 

I'm in the process of obtaining authorization from the family via the documents you sent earlier. As you noted, these records will contain in personal health information of the deceased individual. How do you plan to send these documents?

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #102620237074
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 17, 2023. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on June 12, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #102620237074.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 102620237074  Response Letter.pdf
communications.communication:
Good day Ms. Liss,
Here is a letter in response to your Freedom of information request. In a moment you will receive the results through our BOX software. I'm attaching a free copy of this software in case you don't already have it. It works great for larger documents.

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (San Bruno Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (San Bruno Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alessandro Guzman

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (San Bruno Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Alessandro Guzman
The City of San Bruno Received your request for records under the California Public Records Act (Public Records Act), dated September 23, 2024, requesting the City to produce records listed below regarding the following four software programs:


  *   Thompson Reuters Clear
  *   LexisNexis Accurint
  *   TransUnion TLOxp
  *   SoundThinking Crime Tracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINKX

In accordance with Government Code Section 7922.530(a), this letter serves as the City’s disclosure of responsive records subject to release in response to your request.

The City has records responsive to your request and hereby provides those records to you.  Please note the City has withheld information containing, in part, certain personal identifying information because that information is exempt from disclosure under Section 7922.000 of the California Government Code, as the public interest served in not disclosing the information clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure.

The City is continuing to search for and review additional potentially responsive records.  In particular, the City is searching for the LexisNexis Accruint agreement and any invoices for LexisNexis.   Besides LexisNexis, this disclosure comprehensively lists the requested software programs the City uses.

We estimate that we will be able to provide you with responsive records on or before November 14, 2024. If we require additional time, we will let you know as soon as possible. As always, the City’s goal is to comply promptly with any such requests and we will endeavor to respond earlier if possible.

Sincerely,


[A drawing of a cartoon character  Description automatically generated]
Lupita Huerta
City Clerk
City of San Bruno
567 El Camino Real
San Bruno, CA  94066
(650) 616-7061 [office]
(650) 616-7070 [direct] / lhuerta@sanbruno.ca.gov<mailto:lhuerta@sanbruno.ca.gov>

Monday through Thursday, 7:30 am to 5:30 pm.

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado Medicaid provider list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain an updated electronic list of all Colorado Medicaid healthcare providers with the INCLUSION of their respective National Provider Identifier (NPI) numbers, medicaid ID and state license number (CSV or excel or TXT format are preferred). All types of healthcare practitioners from all dates electronically available (active, inactive and retired licensee data sets would be greatly appreciated. The specific items to be included in data set:

1. Provider first and last name
2. Medicaid Identification number 
3. National Provider Identifier (NPI) number
4. Colorado State License number and initial date of issuance or expiry (if available/applicable)
5. Education / School/Training, if available
6. Provider type (MD, DO, PA, RN, PT, OT, OD, CRNA, DMD, DDS, DPM etc)
7. Provider Specialty
8. Provider Practice Location (Including Practice Name)
9. Please include Data Dictionary describing state Medicaid Data Sets, if available.
10. Status of Active, Inactive, Retired

Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenn Kellogg

Department of Health Care Policy and Financing, are confidential and
intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to which it is

information or otherwise privileged information. Unauthorized review,
forwarding, printing, copying, distributing, or using such information is
strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you received this message in

email without disclosure. Thank you.*

on a State-owned email account may be subject to public disclosure.****

Rose Terse

The purpose of this message is to inform you that your request will be forwarded to the City of Bellevue City Clerk’s Office for handling. Your request is still considered open.  Any request for "any and all" public records, or a request that contains a request for any potentially associated e-mails, correspondence, or the coordination with more than one City department must be handled by their office. We do not conduct e-mail searches in Police Records, nor do we coordinate multi-layered requests. The Bellevue Police Department does not manage the City of Bellevue's traffic cameras, so any request for traffic camera footage should be made through the City Clerk's Office, as well. 
The City Clerk’s Office will be your point of contact for this request moving forward. Your assigned Police Department reference number will be closed and your new reference number from the City Clerk's Office is C000658-080824.  You should anticipate a response from their office by 08/15/24. 
If you have any questions about this process, you may contact the Police Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917. You may reach the City Clerk’s Office at PublicRecords@bellevuewa.gov.

Angel Francois 
Bellevue Police Department

Subject: Clarification and Response City of Bellevue Public Records Request C000658-080824 
August 08, 2024 Dear Rose Terse, 

This email is to confirm that the City of Bellevue has received a public records request from you pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, Ch. 42.56 RCW. Your new public disclosure request number is C000658-080824, which will help us locate your information if you contact us for an update. We are working on your request and estimate that a response will be available on or about September 06, 2024. 

You are requesting: 

All communications (including but not limited to emails, text messages, Microsoft Teams messages, etc), memos, and documents mentioning "Food Not Bombs" or "Bellevue Student Union" since January 1, 2024. Please include any attachments and associated metadata. For text messages and Teams messages, please include messages sent in the chat within 30 minutes of the responsive message for context. 
Your request was originally filed with the Bellevue Police Department.  Since they do not conduct searches for communications, the request was forwarded to the City Clerk's Office for processing.  Please confirm if you are requesting only records to or from City of Bellevue Police Department personnel. 
Once confirmed, we will start the process of identifying records. If additional clarification is needed or there is any change to our response timeline, we will be sure to let you know. Please let us know if you have any questions regarding the processing of your request. 

Sincerely, 
Aimee Vance 
Bellevue Public Records 
425-452-4283

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

Subject: 2nd Installment: Public Records Request C000658-080824 November 08, 2024 Dear Rose Terse, We have made an installment to your Public Records Request C000658-080824 available for your inspection.  You may access the responsive records provided in the Public Records Portal.  Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requester fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. We estimate an update or installment will be provided on or about November 27, 2024. Please let us know if you have any questions or concerns regarding the processing of this request. Subject: Response and Close: Public Records Request C000658-080824 November 27, 2024 Dear Rose Terse, We have concluded our search and have not located any additional responsive records in response to your request: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All communications (including but not limited to emails, text messages, Microsoft Teams messages, etc), memos, and documents mentioning "Food Not Bombs" or "Bellevue Student Union" since January 1, 2024. Please include any attachments and associated metadata. For text messages and Teams messages, please include messages sent in the chat within 30 minutes of the responsive message for context. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 
Rose Terse You may access previously released records in the Public Records Portal.  This is our final, definitive response and your request is closed.  As the city does not intend to further address the request, the Public Records Act one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has now started to run. Please contact us in the next 30 days if you believe additional responsive records have not been provided or if you have any follow-up questions or concerns regarding the processing of this request. Sincerely, Aimee Vance Bellevue Public Records 425-452-4283 How did we do? Please take a few minutes to complete our 10-question online survey.

title: Previous FOIA releases (U.S. Department of Education)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Previous FOIA releases (U.S. Department of Education)
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department of Education,

In official capacity on behalf of Fiat Fiendum only, not in personal capacity, I hereby request the following records under 5 USC 552(a)(3):

1. all records previously released under 5 USC 552(a)(3) by your Department, including every component or otherwise associated agency,  corporation, or other establishment of the executive branch within the meaning of 5 USC 552(f)(1)

2. all records of each request that resulted in any of those prior record releases, including all communications to and from the requester, records of searches conducted, and discussion of the request


For all responsive records, I request:
a. all parts of the record (i.e. no portion of a record with some responsive portion may be considered "non-responsive")
b. all record metadata, such as dates on which they were drafted, passed, went into effect, withdrawn, or similar events; person(s) / office(s) responsible; authors; IDs; revision numbers; email headers; hyperlinks; structural metadata; email addresses; comments; revision history; timestamps; file names and contents; pagination or lack thereof; format specific metadata (e.g. particular to Word, PDF, or paper files); filing location, labeling, & organization; etc.
c. if any classification applies, mandatory declassification review (MDR) under E.O. 13526, and the result of the MDR, including any declassified records.

My request is literally for all records you have previously released under FOIA, and for the associated records about the requests under which they were previously released.

A major objective of this request is to get you to publish all released FOIA records, and all records about requests resulting in those releases, to your electronic FOIA "reading room", pursuant to 5 USC 552(a)(2)(D). There is therefore one exclusion: this request does not cover records that are already publicly available on your electronic FOIA reading room.

Other than that, this request has no time or subject limit whatsoever, other than that the cutoff date is the date of your search.


# Form & format

## Native email format & minimal redaction

Please provide all email records in EML, Maildir, or MBOX format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide all other records in their original electronic format (if electronic), and as one 300dpi color scan PDF per logical document, staple, paperclip, or file folder (whichever is most narrow) if the original is in paper format.

Please note that FOIA requires you to service the maximum extent of my request that can be done via e.g. partial redaction of exempt material. If you believe some portions of a record to be exempt because it contains classified information (18 USC 798), please provide a version of the record redacted to the minimum extent necessary to remove exempt information, along with adequate information to describe the reason for each specific exemption, and without altering any non exempt information (including metadata).

## No new records; electronic & original format

This request does not ask you to create new records.

If you determine that a response would require creating a new record that you do not want to create, please first contact me by email with an explanation of what records you have that would most closely match the information requested and might be acceptable substitutes, so that we can reasonably tailor the request.

In particular, I specifically request that you do not create new documents in response to this request that are modifications of a digital record, such as page-view images, print views, scans, or the like. No such creation or substitution is authorized by FOIA.

However, if the same or similar records are held in both electronic and paper formats, this request includes both the paper and electronic versions. The paper version and the digital version are distinct records, and each may contain distinct information such as handwritten or other markings on the paper copy and embedded metadata in the electronic version.

I specifically request both the original, electronic format record, and (if it contains any additional markings) the paper record.

To the extent that the native electronic format is proprietary or otherwise not in format accessible by widely available, open source software, I also request
1. an export of the proprietary format into a standard, open format, and
2. all proprietary software and documentation necessary to use and understand the original, proprietary format records.

## Rehab Act § 508 compliance

I am partially blind. In accordance with 5 USC 552(a)(3)(B & C) (E-FOIA), Rehabilitation Act § 508, and the FOIA Improvement Act, I require that you respond using original, native format, electronic, machine-processable, accessible, open, and well structured records to the maximum extent possible — for both the content of your response, and any communications about the request (such as response letters).

Please make all correspondence pursuant to this request — including notification and responsive records — by email, with native electronic format records, as specified in the request. I do not authorize you to send anything to me by physical mail unless I specifically state otherwise.

## Compression, passwords, and uploading large files

Multiple files may be sent in a combined, compressed form using standard ZIP, TAR, GZIP, BZIP2, and/or RAR formats, or sent as separate files, at your discretion.

Do not use any password on any files, including ZIP files etc., unless a password was present in the original, native format (in which case, leave it unaltered, and send me the password). Do not respond using ZixCorp "Secure Mail" or any other method that "expires" records from being available. Use only actual email and direct attachments, or upload using the link below, unless I explicitly request otherwise.

If there are any files you prefer not to transfer by email (e.g. if they are >10MB), please upload them to me via the link listed below my signature. Doing so is secure, completely free to you, and I will be notified of the upload. If that is insufficient, I can also provide Google Drive, Dropbox, SFTP, rsync, or similar provisions that will let you easily upload hundreds of gigabytes of data to me for free.

## Redaction of repeatedly occurring content

When redacting any content that appears more than once in the full set of responsive records, please assign a replacement identifier for each, so that your redaction does not obfuscate the commonality.

For example, suppose that responsive records include the names Alice, Bob, and Chris, and you determine that each of those names are redactable (e.g. under (b)(7) or (b)(6)). Rather than redacting each with only the text "(b)(7)(C)", replace each instance of "Alice" with "(b)(7)(D) - confidential source 1", each instance of "Bob" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 2", each instance of "Chris" with "(b)(7)(C) - US congressional aide 3",  etc. This would vindicate your narrow interest in withholding the person's identity, while not withholding the facts of commonality between occurrences, nor the relevant natures of each redacted person, which you would not have justification to withhold.

Please use reasonably descriptive identifiers. For instance, if Alice's name is not redacted but her personal cellphone number is, and that cellphone number appears e.g. both in her email signature and elsewhere by itself, it should in both cases be redacted with the same descriptive identifier, such as "Alice's cell #" (or "confidential source 1's cell #" if her name is redacted, as above). 

For PDFs, this can be specified in the margins if the identifier does not fit in the original space. For more native electronic files, like EML, this can be done by direct editing. If space or file format does not permit you to do so inline or in margins or equivalent, then please use a short code (e.g. "[#52]", and provide a table matching codes to full replacement identifiers in your response letter.

If you make any such redactions, please keep but do not provide a table matching codes/identifiers to the redacted content, for use in case your redaction is examined or overturned on appeal or in litigation.

This is a form and format request pertaining to your process of redaction. Because it only applies in situations when you have already exercised the voluntary decision to alter the records from the original form requested, you have necessarily waived any objection to this section "creating a new record", since your act of redaction itself already "makes a new record" in that limited sense. This is only about how you do a redaction you have already decided to make.

This provision limits the scope of your redaction to the minimum possible extent, so that even if you decide to withhold some particular piece of content, you do not also withhold the fact of its being the same as the same content appearing elsewhere, or the kind of thing redacted. That fact is itself metadata that is explicitly requested as part of this request.

If you decide that the mere fact of two pieces of content being the same is itself withholdable, then please redact it using an identifier that encodes only the reason, and provide a table matching those reason-only identifiers to justifications in your response letter.


# Rolling updates

Please provide me with rolling (incremental) updates, rather than having the entirety of the request be blocked until fully completed.

Please preserve all responsive records that you currently hold, pending release, particularly ones that are currently held in electronic form or format.

Please prioritize rolling updates based on what is most readily available, i.e. such that you release as the greatest amount of records in the fastest time.


# Fee waiver

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial, journalistic purposes;
* by definition, you have already found and disclosed the records for item 1, and your FOIA office itself holds all or nearly all the records for item 2;
* I am requesting records to be provided exclusively in electronic format, with no paper copies, so you should incur no actual costs; and
* by definition, FOIA releases are of public interest, this is exclusively about prior public releases, and making them more widely available advances the goals of the Act.

Furthermore, please bear in mind the statutory obligation under 5 USC 552(a)(2)(D)(ii)(II) to post records to your electronic reading room if they have been "requested" 3 or more times, and released at least once under 552(a)(3).

By definition, all records responsive to item 1 of my request have been requested at least one previous time, and were released at least once under 552(a)(3). This request is at least one more "request" (and that clause is not conditioned on having achieved a release). There may well have been another prior "request". If there was, this request is at least the third, and therefore triggers the mandatory publication requirement. If not, I would nevertheless urge you to exercise your discretion to release them publicly.


# Request tracking numbers and estimated completion date

Upon receipt, and in every followup response, please state your tracking number(s) for this request, as well as your specific estimated completion date. 5 USC 552(a)(7).


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your initial response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.
Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt corporation devoted to public interest journalism, government transparency and accountability, individuals' civil rights, and related issues.

P.S. My full legal name is just Sai. Please use no title for me.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

title: Navy support for 2024 film "The Blue Angels"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Navy support for 2024 film "The Blue Angels"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Navy and the production of the 2024 movie "The Blue Angels," directed by Paul Crowder. I request any and all documents pertaining to Navy support for "The Blue Angels." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Navy and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Blue Angels," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Wicomico County Weekend Incarceration Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Related to Maryland Code §11-801, which permits counties to impose fees on "weekend incarcerated individuals"; specifically 

1. The per diem rate, or daily charge, of the weekend incarceration fee imposed in the county detention/correctional facility both currently and in FY23.
2. The daily “average cost of providing food, lodging, and clothing for an incarcerated individual” in the county detention/correctional facility used to calculate the weekend incarceration fee in FY23.
3. The total number of individuals charged the weekend incarceration fee in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23. 
4. The total amount of fees collected from weekend incarcerated individuals in the county detention/correctional facility in FY23.
5. All policies and procedures regarding the imposition and collection of the weekend incarceration fee, including but not limited to guidelines on how these fees are determined and collected in the county detention/correctional facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wayne Byun

title: Israel Payment For Damage to USS Liberty During June 8, 1967 IDF Attack.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Israel Payment For Damage to USS Liberty During June 8, 1967 IDF Attack.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The USS Liberty was attacked by the Israel Defense Force on June 8, 1967. I am a survivor of that attack.

In 1980 the Israeli government agreed to pay $6,000,000 for the damage to the ship.

I am requesting all correspondence between the US and Israeli governments related to the payment for the damage to the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

The USS Liberty was attacked by the Israel Defense Force on June 8, 1967. I

between the US and Israeli governments related to the payment for the
damage to the USS Liberty.

Our office handles FOIA and Privacy Act requests for NARA’s operational records

communications.subject: [25-09771] Freedom of Information Act Request - Joe Meadors
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Meadors:

This is in response to your November 17, 2024 Freedom of Information Act
(FOIA) request for copies of all correspondence between the U.S. and
Israeli governments related to the December 1980 payment of $6,000,000 as
compensation for damage to the USS Liberty caused by the June 8, 1967
attack on the ship by Israel Defense Force jet fighters and torpedo boats.

Your FOIA request was received by my office on November 20, 2024 and
assigned tracking number 25-09771.

Although we located the series Record Group 59 Entry UD-UP 97 General
Records of the Department of State. Office of the Legal Adviser. U.S.S.
Liberty Claims Files, 1966–1969 <https://catalog.archives.gov/id/26309157>,
as well as electronic telegrams pertaining to USS Liberty-related claims,
sent between the Department of State and various U.S. embassies during 1976
<https://aad.archives.gov/aad/display-partial-records.jsp?f=4412&mtch=1&q=%22USS+Liberty%22&cat=all&dt=2082&tf=X&bc=sl>,
1977
<https://aad.archives.gov/aad/display-partial-records.jsp?f=4792&mtch=2&q=%22SS+Liberty%22&cat=all&dt=2532&tf=X&bc=sl>
and 1978
<https://aad.archives.gov/aad/display-partial-records.jsp?f=4994&mtch=3&q=%22USS+Liberty%22&cat=all&dt=2694&tf=X&bc=sl>,
we were not able to locate pertinent correspondence between the governments
of the United States and Israel.

Given that the State Department central file records dating from January 1,
1980 have not yet been accessioned to the National Archives for preservation,
it is possible that the correspondence you seek remains in the custody of
the Department of State.  Access to those records may be requested
by contacting the Department of State FOIA Office at:
https://foia.state.gov/Contact/Default.aspx

If the Department of State transferred series to the National Archives that
include relevant records, please ask them to provide an accession or
transfer number.

We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our actions, your options for appeal and dispute
resolution are outlined in the attachment.

you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I am hereby submitting a Public Records Request for all money given from Middlesex Community College to external vendors/suppliers in FY2015 through (and including) FY2024, a total of 10 years.

Specifically, the data I am requesting include (but are not limited to):
* all vendors, suppliers, individuals, and public-private partnerships
* all materials, goods, services, properties, commodities, equipment leases, property leases, and licenses
* all catalog orders, non-catalog orders, blanket orders, direct payments, bank card purchases, strategic sourcing, and competitive procurements
* all auxiliary services purchases (starts in 2022, may be from a different accounting system)
* all purchase orders, requisitions, and invoices
* all products, goods, services, contracts, and subcontracts
* all accounts, classes, commodities, and departments
* regardless of the funding source

I’m requesting the data in a single Excel spreadsheet file (.xlsx format) with at least the following columns:
* Amount
* Supplier/Vendor Name
* Account Description
* Commodity Description
* Fiscal Year
* Department/Origin Description

Please report every expense, even if one or more of the above fields is blank. Please also include negative expense amounts, which is rare but does occur.

In case it’s helpful, I've attached an image example of what I’m hoping to receive. The columns may be in any order, and the fiscal years may be on one sheet or different sheets. The columns can be sorted in any order, or unsorted if that’s easiest.

I’m anticipating that this request may be fulfilled by a simple financial report generation and export of the generated file, and therefore shouldn’t take much human time or incur any fees. Please let me know immediately if this isn’t the case, so I can modify my request as necessary to meet the PRL deadline of 10 business days.

Please email the Excel file by the deadline of Monday August 26th, 2024.

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli
Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Allison,

Thank you for this information. Unfortunately, I don't see some critical vendor expenses, such as payments to Sodexo for their dining services since FY22 and Apple Spice since FY24. Sometimes these types of payments are in a secondary auxiliary accounting system, and aren't included in the standard reports.

Could you please include these vendor expenses in the report, and any other similar types of missing expenses?

Thanks very much,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Allison,

I'm just checking in about this FOIA request?

Thanks,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
My apologies for a delayed response.

This list was all encompassing, we do not have contracted subsidized dining on site.

Apple Spice DBA “Boston Box Lunch and Catering” utilized our dining facilities using a “for profit” Business model for two semesters and has served a caterer on numerous occasions all of which is represented on this list.

Additionally we did not conduct any business with Sodexo.
Many Thanks

Allison Chambers

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Allison,

I see the "Boston Box Lunch and Catering" entries, thank you for the additional info.

I'm getting the Sodexo information from the MCC Contracts webpage, under "Snack, Beverage and Fresh Food Vending" bid #MCC-2022-02:
https://www.middlesex.edu/finance/bidsandcontracts.html

I've attached a screenshot.

Am I misreading the contract entry?

Thanks for your help!

AJ Vincelli

files.title: Sodexo.jpg
files.source: AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication: Sodexo won a contract to fill our vending machines. We do not pay them, we make a very small commission on the items moved through the vending machines.

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Middlesex CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Oh, that makes sense! Thank you very much. In that case, I think I have everything I need!

Thanks again,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (San Francisco Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CISA / ANALYGENCE 2024 Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The contract between CISA and ANALYGENCE, awarding them a contract for helping with the CISA "Vulnrichment" program, and/or any support related to CVE ID analysis. Specifically, the amount of money dedicated to that specific task, the terms and conditions of said work, expected requirements, and any deadlines. A copy of the full contract with line-item expenditures is sufficient to fill this request.

Reference: 
https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-announces-cve-enrichment-project-vulnrichment/
https://app.g2xchange.com/fedciv/posts/dhs-awards-227m-contract-for-coordinated-vulnerability-disclosure-support

I am an amateur journalist and will use these documents in part of my published work. I understand that there may be fees associated with this document retrieval and hereby agree to pay up to $100 for the retrieval and duplication of the requested documents. If the fee is in excess of $100, please contact me before beginning any work.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Wadhwa:

This e-mail confirms that the Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office (“MCSO”) is in receipt of your request under the Maryland Public Information Act, Md. Code Ann. Gen. Prov. (“GP”) §§ 4-101 – 4-501, seeking certain training records.  Specifically, you request “[a]ny and all training materials used in the past two years (January 1, 2022 through January 1, 2024) that mention excited delirium/ agitated delirium / bell’s mania / lethal catatonia.”  The MCSO received your request on October 25, 2024, and began to process it.  I write to advise you that it will take us more than ten (10) working days to produce the records.  I will follow-up  this e-mail when we have an estimate of the date we expect to be able to produce the records.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns regarding the MCSO’s processing of your request.

communications.subject: 2024 MPIA 0024 RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Excited Delirium / Agitated Delirium Training Materials (Montgomery County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Wadhwa:

The Montgomery County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) has completed its search for certain training records sought in your request below.  The only identified training record that falls within the time period specified by your request, i.e., January 1, 2022 through January 1, 2024, and that references one of the specified conditions, excited delirium, is attached as a one-page document.  That document was a slide within the TASER Energy Weapon Operator Certification Course (Version 23 prepared by Axon Enterprise, Inc.), which has been used in training for deputies effective as of May  1, 2023.  Only deputies trained after that date would have been exposed to that particular slide during their annual TASER training.

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Department of Commerce)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Department of Commerce)
communications.communication:
Dear Department of Commerce,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Department of Commerce's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of

Suspect Name: Andrea Luncsford
Description/Headline: Baby who died after mom left him in hot car passed away from cocaine intoxication
Link of the Article: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/crime/baby-hot-car-death-cocaine-intoxication-b2631093.html
State: Illinois
Law Enforcement: Peoria Police 

Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request #COP-2024-4825
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

Please clarify what you are asking of our office. Our office only reviews FOIA denials and OMA violations. If you are trying to request records, you will need to submit the FOIA request below to the public body you are seeking responsive records from. We do not process FOIA requests for other public bodies. If you are seeking a request for review, we will need the following:

1. Something in writing requesting review by our office and stating why you would like the review. This must be signed by you. (If you send by email, you can type your name).
2. Copy of the FOIA request you submitted to the public body.
3. The public body’s response. If they did not respond, please state that in your request for review.

Please keep in mind you have 60 days from the date of denial within which to file your request for review.

If you have any other questions, please feel free to email this email box or call our hotline at 877-299-3642 and we will be happy to assist you.


Very truly,

Mariel Perales
Administrative Clerk
Public Access Bureau
Illinois Attorney General’s Office
Hotline #: 877-299-3642
